title: Error when deleting experiments in a remote tracking server
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: no
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**:  pip install mlflow
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 0.7.0
- **Python version**: 3.x
- **npm version (if running the dev UI):
- **Exact command to reproduce**:
  -  Step 1: Set tracking URI for the remote mlfow server in the environment variables (e.g. set MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://x.x.x.x:5000
  - list experiments with: _mlflow experiments list_ 
  - Step 2: Delete one of the tracked experiment specifying experiment id
    -  for example: mlflow experiments delete 2

### Describe the problem
Describe the problem clearly here. Be sure to convey here why it's a bug in MLflow or a feature request.
**It looks like _rest_store.py_ is receiving the experiment ID as a strin,g but it assumes it is an integer when it tries to prepare the json request. So the string argument (experiment_id) needs to be converted into an int before passing it to message_to_json(...) method.**

### Source code / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks,
please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.
Try to provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem.

```
(env) C:\Users\user>mlflow experiments delete 1
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\runpy.p
y", line 193, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\runpy.p
y", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "C:\Users\user\Documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\Scripts\mlf
low.exe\__main__.py", line 9, in <module>
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\site-pa
ckages\click\core.py", line 764, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\site-pa
ckages\click\core.py", line 717, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\site-pa
ckages\click\core.py", line 1137, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\site-pa
ckages\click\core.py", line 1137, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\site-pa
ckages\click\core.py", line 956, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\site-pa
ckages\click\core.py", line 555, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\site-pa
ckages\mlflow\experiments.py", line 64, in delete_experiment
    store.delete_experiment(experiment_id)
  File "c:\users\user\documents\_dev\anaconda3\envs\env\lib\site-pa
ckages\mlflow\store\rest_store.py", line 117, in delete_experiment
    req_body = message_to_json(DeleteExperiment(experiment_id=experiment_id))
TypeError: '1' has type str, but expected one of: int, long
```

Edit: following code in rest_store.py fixed it for me but proper solution needs to be investigated:

```
    def delete_experiment(self, experiment_id):
        experiment_id = int(experiment_id)
        req_body = message_to_json(DeleteExperiment(experiment_id=experiment_id))
        self._call_endpoint(DeleteExperiment, req_body)

```
